title: Transfer Deadline Day LIVE : Man Utd offered Bayern star , Jorginho to Arsenal and Fernandez to Chelsea latest
body_text:
January transfer deadline day is the most frantic date in the football calendar, and we got plenty of late, late drama.
Arsenal confirmed the signing of Chelsea midfielder Jorginho for £12million, while Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag swooped for Marcel Sabitzer on loan from Bayern Munich, with a deal confirmed right at the death.
Chelsea were another team to leave it late, British record fee for Enzo Fernandez. The Blues are understood to have sealed an eleventh-hour deal for the Argentina international for a British record fee, having already spent more than £100m earlier in the window.
Tottenham have finally got their man in Pedro Porro, the Sporting Lisbon wing-back, while he arrives Matt Doherty is a shock exit, heading to Atletico Madrid on a free.
The deadline has passed for Premier League clubs to make transfers, they can still pick up free agents. One name to keep an eye on is Ghana forward Andre Ayew, who could yet complete a move to Everton.
For all the fall-out from a busy transfer deadline day, follow our Mirror Football live blog below...
Goodnight!
That's unfortunately all we've got time for this evening.
Join us bright and early tomorrow morning for even more of the transfer window fall-out.
La Liga chiefs bemoan Prem spend
La Liga officials have called for further regulation after accusing Premier League clubs of "doping" and "cheating" with their record-breaking January spending.
Top-flight clubs in England were extraordinarily busy during the winter transfer window and forked out a reported £815million.
Fernandez sends Boehly message
Enzo Fernandez has thanked Todd Boehly and Chelsea for "doing everything they could" to get his £107million move over the line.
"I am grateful to Chelsea and its ownership for doing everything they could to make me a part of this project," Fernandez told Chelsea's website during his first interview since the move. Fernandez, who arrived on Wednesday to complete his move, also highlighted that his ambition is to instantly compete for the "biggest trophies" with the big-spending Blues.
Everton consider Isco swoop
Alongside talks for Andre Ayew, Everton are reportedly aiming to seal the services of another free agent on the form of Isco.
The Spaniard was meant to move to German side Union Berlin on deadline day only for the deal to collapse. As per The Times, Everton are now considering a swoop for the Spaniard with Sean Dyche desperate to bolster his side.
Chelsea prepare summer sales
Chelsea are ready to cash-in on up to six members of their squad following what has been an eye-watering January spend at Stamford Bridge.
The Blues rounded off a huge £323m winter splurge on deadline day with Benfica and Argentina star Enzo Fernandez becoming the eighth player to arrive in West London throughout the month. Their stunning business leaves current boss Graham Potter with a hugely bloated squad to choose from for the remainder of the campaign.
Fernandez squad number revealed
Chelsea have revealed that deadline day signing Enzo Fernandez is set to wear the number five shirt during his time at Stamford Bridge.
The Blues have also shared images of the Argentine wearing his new kit for the first time:
Ayew flies in for talks
Whilst the transfer window has been shut for nearly 24 hours, deals could still potentially go through. One of the players that could arrive is former West Ham and Swansea forward Andre Ayew.
According to The Mail, The Ghanaian is flying into the UK to hold talks with a couple of sides. Everton are thought to be among those, whilst Nottingham Forest have also been credited with an interest in him.
Cancelo handed Bayern debut
Man City defender Joao Cancelo has been handed a quickfire debut for Bayern Munich having been named in their starting XI for tonight's game.
The German champions take on Mainz 05 in the German Cup with Cancelo having been named in the Bayern line-up.
He completed a move to the Allianz Arena on deadline day.
Modric hands Liverpool Bellingham boost
Staying in Spain and Ballon d'Or winner Luka Modric appears to have handed Liverpool a huge boost in their attempts to sign Jude Bellingham.
According to AS, the Croatian midfielder has decided to stay with Real Madrid for a further year. He is out of contract this summer but negotiations between him and Real are expected to be straight-forward.
That could potentially alleviate Los Blancos' need to enter the market for another midfielder - namely Bellingham.
Barcelona prepare Roberto offer
Barcelona are reportedly set to offer former Arsenal target Sergi Roberto a new contract to stay at the Camp Nou.
The 30-year-old sees his current deal expire in the summer but as per Mundo Deportivo, the Spanish giants are set to hand him a year's extension with the option of a further season.
The utility man has neen linked with a move to the Premier League on occasions in the past with Arsenal noted as admirers.
Harrison underwent Leicester medical
Leeds star Jack Harrison reportedly started a medical with Leicester City only for Jesse Marsch's side to pull the plug.
The Foxes were linked with a move for the wideman over the final days of the window. As per The Athletic, Harrison travelled to Leicester's training ground and started a medical before Leeds decided not to proceed with a sale.
Arsenal sent £100m Caicedo warning
Brighton warned Arsenal off Moises Caicedo in January by insisting they wouldn’t even sell the midfielder for £100million. Caicedo returned to training on Wednesday at Brighton after failing to secure a move away from the club during the transfer window.
The Seagulls rejected two bids from Arsenal for the Ecuador international, the second worth around £70m. Caicedo informed Brighton in an open letter on social media last week that he wanted a move but his post backfired back.
It infuriated Albion so much they point blank refused to sell Caicedo to the Premier League leaders. Brighton officials also told Arsenal's sporting director Edu that not even £100m would prise Caicedo away.
PSG hit out at Chelsea
French giants PSG have reportedly slammed Chelsea as a "Class-A circus" after Hakim Ziyech's failed move to the Parc des Princes.
The Moroccan winger was expected to join the French gianrs on-loan until the end of the season only to see a move fall through at the final moment. According to The Telegraph, relations between the two clubs have hit rock bottom with PSG left furious and blaming Chelsea for the embarrassment.
Enzo Fernandez pens farewell statement
Chelsea signing Enzo Fernandez has penned an emotional statement to former club Benfica after sealing his record-breaking move to Stamford Bridge.
Taking to social media, he said: "May the press not tarnish what we built together because it was something wonderful that I had never imagined. Thank you to everyone who works to make the institution even greater than it is.
"Thank you to my colleagues for always treating me in the best way and make me feel at home. Thanks to the club's management and especially to Roger Schmidt and his entire team for their trust and daily respect. I was very happy. Thank you, I carry Benfica forever in my heart."
Ziyech could still leave
Today has been a bad day for Hakim Ziyech, who thought he was leaving Chelsea for Paris Saint-Germain, only to see his hopes dashed in a mess of paperwork.
The Moroccan winger could still leave Chelsea, however, with reports in Turkey suggesting that Besiktas are keen to sign him.
The Turkish transfer window is still open for another week.
Wolves seal Traore deal
Wolves have made the signing of Boubacar Traore permanent.
The Mali international arrived on loan from Metz in September and has since made nine appearances for the club.
Wolves have liked what they've seen and have now chosen to sign the 21-year-old.
Ryan Reynolds struggles with Wrexham arrival
Ryan Reynolds struggled to get to grips with the pronunciation of Wrexham's new signing Eoghan O'Connell.
The Welsh side, who currently sit top of the National League as they eye a return to the Football League, added the centre-half on deadline day.
O'Connell was signed from Charlton for an undisclosed fee and could make his debut this weekend against Altrincham.
Coutinho could still leave Villa
The European transfer window is shut – but Philippe Coutinho could still leave Aston Villa.
Goal Brazil has spoken to the playmaker’s agent, Kia Joorabchian, who says they’re still working on a transfer.
Corinthians remain interested in signing the 30-year-old, but the money involved could be problematic, with Coutinho’s wages and Villa’s desire to recoup some of the fee they paid Barcelona holding things up.
Fernandez flying to London
Enzo Fernandez's transfer to Chelsea has been confirmed - but we're yet to get the full unveiling from the Blues.
It seems that could be on its way later today, with the 22-year-old midfielder flying from Portugal to London.
Enzo Fernández, on his way to London #CFC pic.twitter.com/QCpXmy0Whi
— Fabrizio Romano (@FabrizioRomano) February 1, 2023
Ayew heading for talks
The window may have closed, but Premier League sides can still sign free agents.
Andre Ayew is one of those players available - and he's flying into London to hold talks with Everton and another club after being released by Al Sadd.
The 33-year-old striker has previously played for West Ham and Swansea.
Haaland agent details exit plan
Erling Haaland's agent Rafaela Pimenta refused to deny the striker has an exit clause in his Manchester City contract - but admitted she would have to say "yes" to Barcelona president Joan Laporta.
Barca boss Xavi headed a club delegation flying out to Germany to hold a meeting with the striker a year ago as the Blaugrana considered the possibility of a move for Haaland.
The Catalan club held a meeting with Mino Raiola, who had represented Haaland before he passed away last year, in December 2021.
Maguire told a loan could have been good
Former Manchester United striker Louis Saha has suggested a loan exit could have benefited club captain Harry Maguire.
“A loan move may have been a good option for him to show that he’s worth another try because he’s still a key player and he’s Manchester United’s captain," the Frenchman told The Games Cabin.
"Even if Erik ten Hag isn’t playing him often, I expect that Ten Hag still respects the player and wants to see him improve. It’s still possible for him to contribute.”
Arsenal's Caicedo hopes take a hit
Arsenal's hopes of signing Moises Caicedo this summer may have taken a hit following their recent approach.
The Gunners were looking to bolster their midfield options in January - eventually signing Jorginho from London rivals Chelsea on deadline day.
They begun pursuing the Italian when it became clear they weren't going to be successful in chasing the Ecuadorian.
Herrera makes Bilbao move permanent
Athletic Club have completed the permanent signing of Ander Herrera from Paris Saint-Germain.
Herrera, who was already on loan from PSG in Bilbao, has now signed a contract until June 2024 with the Spanish side after they utilised a clause in the loan agreement.
Cedric speaks after Arsenal exit
Cedric Soares has spoken for the first time after joining Fulham on loan from Arsenal.
"I feel great," the Portugal insternational said.
"I wanted this deal to happen, so we all pushed in the same direction, and I’m really happy and pleased to be here."
Enzo Fernandez's Chelsea shirt number
It appears Enzo Fernandez will take the vacant number five shirt at Chelsea.
The number was previously worn by Jorginho, who completed his departure for Arsenal earlier on deadline day.
Other players to wear five for Chelsea in the Premier League era include Kurt Zouma, Michael Essien and Frank Leboeuf.
Ten Hag pushed for Henderson Man Utd return
Erik ten Hag attempted to persuade goalkeeper Dean Henderson to return to Manchester United from his loan spell at Nottingham Forest in January.
United had to react to the decision of Newcastle to recall Martin Dubravka from his loan spell at Old Trafford, prompting them to draft in Jack Butland from Crystal Palace on a loan deal for the remainder of the campaign.
Henderson has previously spoken out against his treatment by his parent club.
Caicedo back in Brighton training
Moises Caicedo has returned to Brighton training after failing to secure a move away from the club, according to The Express.
The Ecuador midfielder was the subject of interest from Arsenal, but has remained at the Amex Stadium for the remainder of the season.
It remains to be seen whether he will feature this weekend, with Roberto De Zerbi's team taking on Bournemouth in the league.
Ayew set to arrive in England
Andre Ayew is expected in England in the next 24 hours, with Everton eyeing up a deal for the Ghana international.
Sean Dyche's side could complete a move for the former West Ham and Swansea man outside the window, as he is a free agent after leaving Al-Sadd.
According to The Mail, Ayew's chances of joining the Toffees are rated at 50/50, with interest from other Premier League sides.
River set for huge Fernandez windfall
Enzo Fernandez's former club River Plate are set to receive a whopping £26.75million after the Argentina international completed his move from Benfica to Chelsea.
The midfielder completed a £107m switch to Stamford Bridge after protracted negotiations between the Blues and Benfica.
The fee is a record for Chelsea, trumping the £97.5m they paid for Romelu Lukaku in 2021, and also a new Premier League record.
